transcript:
Emily Carter: Hi John, this is Emily Carter from InfiniMeld. How are you today?

John Matthews: Hi Emily, I'm doing well, thanks. How about you?

Emily Carter: I'm great, thank you for asking. I wanted to follow up with you regarding the proposal we sent over. I understand you're looking for some further negotiation on pricing.

John Matthews: Yes, that's correct. We've reviewed the proposal in depth, and while we're very interested in what InfiniMeld has to offer, we do have some concerns about the cost.

Emily Carter: I completely understand, John. Let’s dive into those concerns. What specific aspects of the pricing are you looking to discuss?

John Matthews: Primarily, the initial setup fee and the ongoing subscription costs. We are looking to see if there is any flexibility there, especially given our budget constraints at the moment.

Emily Carter: Got it. Just to make sure we're on the same page, you're referring to the $20,000 setup fee and the $5,000 monthly subscription, correct?

John Matthews: Yes, that's right. We were hoping to see if there's any room for a discount, particularly on the setup fee.

Emily Carter: We can certainly discuss that. Could you give me a little more context about your budget constraints? It would help me understand how we can best accommodate your needs.

John Matthews: Sure. As a cybersecurity firm, we've been channeling a significant amount of our funds into R&D lately. This has made our discretionary budget a bit tighter than usual. We're also evaluating several other tools, so we need to be mindful of our overall expenses.

Emily Carter: I see, that makes a lot of sense. Given how crucial R&D is for your industry, I understand why you're being cautious. One potential way we could approach this is offering an installment plan for the setup fee. How does that sound to you?

John Matthews: That could be helpful. How would that work exactly?

Emily Carter: We could break down the $20,000 setup fee into four or five smaller payments spread over several months. This way, it won't hit your budget all at once. Would that be more manageable?

John Matthews: Yes, that would definitely ease some of the financial pressure. However—sorry if I sound pushy—is there a possibility for a direct reduction in the setup fee itself?

Emily Carter: I appreciate your candor, John. Let me check what can be done. Given the value our platform offers, even a small reduction wouldn't jeopardize the setup quality and support we provide. Could you meet me halfway if we were able to lower the setup fee by 10%, making it $18,000?

John Matthews: A 10% reduction sounds like a good concession on your part. But still, do you think there might be a bit more room? Say, getting it down to around $15,000? That would be more aligned with our budget.

Emily Carter: I appreciate your position and willingness to work things out. I'll need to discuss this internally to see what we can do. In the meantime, let's also consider ways to maximize the value you get from our services, perhaps we could bundle in some additional features or extended support at no extra cost to make the deal more appealing?

John Matthews: That's an interesting proposition. Could you elaborate on what additional features or support could be included?

Emily Carter: Of course. We could offer an extended support plan, giving you 24/7 priority customer service for the first six months. Additionally, we could include a full data analysis package for the first quarter to help you get the most out of your new data warehouse.

John Matthews: That definitely adds value. The extended support and data analysis package would be very beneficial for us, especially as we get started.

Emily Carter: I'm glad to hear that. Let's say we proceed with those additional benefits—would that make the current pricing structure more acceptable for you?

John Matthews: It certainly makes the offer more attractive. Still, if there's any way to lower the setup fee further, it would help seal the deal more comfortably from our end.

Emily Carter: I understand, John. Let me consult with our finance department to see if we can accommodate your request for a $15,000 setup fee along with the added benefits. Can I get back to you by tomorrow with an update?

John Matthews: That sounds fair, Emily. I'll be looking forward to your update.

Emily Carter: Thank you for your patience, John. One last thing before we wrap up, do you have any concerns or questions about the ongoing subscription costs, or are we mainly focused on the initial setup?

John Matthews: It's mainly the initial setup fee that's our sticking point. The ongoing subscription cost is aligned with our expectations and budget.

Emily Carter: Excellent. I'll place emphasis on addressing the setup fee in my conversation with our finance team. Is there anything else you’d like to discuss right now?

John Matthews: That covers everything from our side for now. Thanks for being so accommodating, Emily.

Emily Carter: Anytime, John. I appreciate your openness. I'll speak with our team and get back to you by tomorrow. Have a great day!

John Matthews: Thank you, Emily. You too. Goodbye.

Emily Carter: Goodbye, John.
